name: Crowne Plaza Anaheim - Garden Grove

reviews.text: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza because of a family wedding in the area. The hotel was fine but nothing to write home about. Our room and the hotel seemed to be a bit tired and old but otherwise sufficient. One thing I found surprising is that the bathroom is did not have a vent so when you took a shower, the room filled up with steam and it took quite a while to clear. There are several restaurants within walking distance and many more within a 10-15 min car ride so that is very convenient. Oh, one more thing .... Check-in took quite a while because the hotel's systems were down and everything had to be done manually. Hopefully that doesn't happen very often.
reviews.title: Nothing to write home about

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights part of a Disney vacation package that was purchased from Costco travel. With the Disney Costco travel package you do not have to pay the "resort fees" which i believe is $14 a day. You get a voucher for "kids eat free" breakfast, lunch or dinner for everyday of your stay, and you also get the option to check out late (2 pm). I strongly recommend signing up for the free Crowne Plaza priority rewards club, which gives you an upgrade to the "executive floor" and also 2 complimentary bottles of water and 2 complimentary drink coupons for the bar.
reviews.title: Good choice for a Disney trip

reviews.text: Our room was on the executive floor located on the 8th floor with a nice view. The room was nice and spacious and included a refrigerator which was great.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: I know many people complain about the parking for the hotel, I had no problem with the parking. the first day we did park we could not find parking close to the hotel so we did park a bit far which was no big deal. Later that night there was many available parking spots right next to the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Venue for a Ballroom Event

reviews.text: One of the added bonus i believe is the complimentary shuttle they offer every half an hour to and from Disneyland, on the weekend i noticed that they ran every 15 minutes.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: * Priceline accepted my price and gave me the Crowne Plaza. Based on many of the reviews here, I had some reservations (no pun intended) about staying here.
reviews.title: Review for families headed off to Disney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: *We arrived a day earlier than expected. We called to see if they had an extra room. They did not. So, at 3:00 am we scrambled for a place to stay. Fortunately we were able to find one in front of Disneyland. A roach motel, if you will.
reviews.title: This was a great hotel

reviews.text: *So, we arrived the next day (11:00 am) as scheduled. The parking lot situation is a bit inconvenient but manageable. Maybe 50-100 yards to the hotel at most depending on where you get a spot. We were fortunate to have one of the first spots. You have to enter the hotel through a rear exit, then the swimming area, then the lobby.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: *I should have known THIS beforehand. BUT, 4:00 PM check in time? Really? Can you get any later than that (sarcastic)? That said, the lady 'assisting' us at the front desk was very nice and very pleasant to deal with. We decided to head off to Disney because our room would not be ready until 2:00 pm at the earliest.
reviews.title: Where you SHOULD stay when going to the Park

reviews.text: *She recommended that we take the 'free' shuttle. We went out and there were dozens of people waiting in line. So, we opted to cab it (in fact, for the remainder of the trip, we cabbed it to and from Disney). All in all, the cab rides varied from approximately 8.50 - 10.00 w/o tip. I thought it was worth it.
reviews.title: Reliable accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for a few days in December 2012.
reviews.title: Did not enjoy stay, stuck up staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arriving to the hotel, we were pleased with the outside and the well maintained landscape. But when we started looking for parking is when the issues started. Parking is VERY far from the front entrance. Especially if they are hosting an event, they close the back entry to only allow people from a certain party in. It is about a 10min walk from your car to the front entry. This may not seem like alot but when you think about it being a parking lot and getting to the front entry of somewhere with luggage, it is. They do offer you a shuttle from the parking lot to the front sometimes but then again a 15min wait.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.text: Overlooking the parking issue, we still wanted to have a good time so we went to check in. Once we got to the front desk we dealt with the most rude and unpleasant young woman ever. She seemed to be talking down to me and spoke to me in a way that someone would speak to little children who have done something bad. She then informed me of the $150 incidental hold that they charge and is refunded later. She also informed me of the resort fee of $12 per day. This was fine and it only took me by surprise because I didn't read the terms and conditions, my fault. When I handed her the money, she took it as if she was disgusted by it and then handed me over to another woman who we assumed would be more pleasant. Again, wrong. Not sure if this is the way that they train their employees to talk to people or if me being of another ethnicity had anything to do with it. We still smiled and thanked them, there is no reason to make a scene somewhere when I can simply express my concerns here.
reviews.title: Just Simply Fabulous!

reviews.text: After check in, we made our way up to the room. The wait for the elevator is pretty long even though there are 4 elevators available. Once inside the room, it was clean and smelled good, but with their 3 1/2 star rating, you would expect more. The renovations were mediocre. Almost as if they completed renovations in a rush to finish but either way, they were renovated so I cannot complain too much.
reviews.title: Very Pleased...overall

reviews.text: Sleep was good until we began to hear the kids and baby in the next room. Not sure if we just happened to be lucky enough to be put next to a room with the worlds loudest crying kids or if the walls are thin but they were up for a couple hours. Nothing ear plugs couldn't help. The next morning, we did take advantage of their free shuttle to Disney. It leaves every half an hour I believe and picks you up in the same place. It's an older bus with cranky drivers but it's was free(besides the resort fees).
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: I booked this place as a 3-1/2 start hotel using Priceline for one night so I didn't get to know the place that well. What my family and experienced was definitely above average. I would definitely say this is a business friendlier place because it's walking distance to the Convention Center and has nice amenities inside like the solid Wi-Fi, desk, business center, etc. Families going to Disneyland may want to try something closer to the park because it's a good two miles from the entrance and the drive down Harbor Blvd. is not exactly the happiest place on Earth. Other things worth noting are the friendly staff, clean room, comfortable beds and a great looking pool area. Self parking was free but a bit of a challenge and haul when the area was fairly busy.
reviews.title: GREAT FOR BUSINESS, SO SO FOR FAMILIES

reviews.text: Still, I would recommend this place and would stay there again for a quick overnighter with the family or any type of business trip.
reviews.title: Goa La Dance Guests from San Francisco

reviews.text: Great location for events, weddings, conventions. Awesome service at all levels. We enjoyed our stay and the lovely B-fast. Thanks to the Management and staff of crown plaza that provided excellent service and attention to all the guests of a big event.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, very enjoyable stay!

reviews.text: We stayed at The Crowne Plaza Resort Anaheim-Garden Grove for a Christmas event. The hotel was great, staff was friendly and professional. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable, family friendly and close to everything. My kids liked the hotel so much, they want to come back and stay here the next time we go to Disneyland. I would highly recommend this hotel to my friends and family.
reviews.title: Tis the Season

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here a week before Christmas and it was a wonderful expereince. With everything from Disneyland to Target close at hand, we were right in the middle of all the action. Yet after a busy day retiring to quiet comfort of the hotel was very refreshing. The staff were attentive to our every need. Room were very clean and we loved the endless breakfast in the morning!
reviews.title: An extremely well managed hotel!

aka: Crowne Plaza Anaheim - Garden Grove Hotel Garden Grove
description: The Crowne Plaza Resort Anaheim-Garden Grove is less then one mile from both theDisneyland and California Adventure Theme Park and Anaheim convention center. The Crowne Plaza Resort Anaheim just underwent a $4 million guest room renovation to ensure you have a superior sleep experience. Whether you are here for business or travel you will be thrilled by our newly renovated guest rooms. Every aspect has been perfected, from the ergonomically correct desk and chair, improved lighting, 32 inch LCD TV, plush carpeting and comfortable new bed where you will feel right at home. The Crowne Plaza Resort Anaheim is a full service resort offering 379 luxurious guest rooms, including 96 executive rooms and 30,000 sq. feet of flexible meeting space. Enjoy the California Grill and Cantina; outdoor heated pool and spa The hotel charges a nominal daily resort fee of $12.00 per day, which includes: self parking, Disney Resort Shuttle, access to the fitness center, use of the business center, in-room high speed Internet access, wireless high speed Internet in all public areas and a California Tourism Fee and Marketing Assessment.
